verses.verse: {To the Director: A Davidic Psalm.} {The Fool and God's Response} d Fools say to themselves, "There is no God." They are corrupt and commit evil deeds; not one of them practices what is good.
The LORD looks down from the heavens upon humanity {Lit. upon the sons of Adam} to see if anyone shows discernment as he searches for God.
All have turned away, together they have become corrupt; no one practices what is good, not even one.
Will those who do evil ever learn? They devour my people like they devour bread, and never call on the Lord .
There they are seized with terror, because God is with those who are {Lit. with the generation of the} righteous.
You would frustrate the plans of the oppressed, {Or the poor} but the LORD is their refuge.
May Israel's deliverance come from Zion! When the LORD restores the fortunes of his people, Jacob will rejoice, and Israel will be glad. {Cf. Ps 53:1-6}
